algorithm_technique: Binary search on the time. For a given time `x`, check if all grains can be eaten by hens.
problem_summary_simple: Determine the minimum time required for hens to eat all grains, considering their movement and optimal assignment.
problem_summary_technical: Binary search on time. The check function greedily assigns hens to grains, considering movement left and right within time `x`.
time_complexity: O(M log M + N log N + (M + N) log R)
key_insights: Sorting both hens and grains is essential for the greedy assignment within the check function.
The check function needs to consider that a hen can move left or right to cover grains.
The optimal strategy for a hen is to cover the leftmost unassigned grain and then extend its reach to the right.
